meanings.sent1: The cowboy rowelled his horse to make it go faster.
meanings.sent2: She rowelled the boots with shiny spurs before the rodeo.
meanings.sent3: The knight rowelled his loyal steed, causing it to trot comically.
meanings.sent4: Her words rowelled his determination, spurring him on to achieve his goal.
meanings.sent5: The sharp rowels rowelled the horse's sides, leaving a lasting impression.

meanings.definition: To prick or urge with a rowel.
meanings.sent1: The jockey rowelled the horse to encourage it during the race.
meanings.sent2: He rowelled his friend to take action and not give up.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel rowelled the cat, causing it to jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her teasing remarks rowelled his pride, making him work harder to prove himself.
meanings.sent5: The coach rowelled the team with a motivational speech before the championship game.

meanings.sent1: The rowelled spurs jingled as he walked across the wooden floor.
meanings.sent2: She admired the rowelled design on the cowboy boots.
meanings.sent3: The rowelled belt added a touch of western flair to his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The rowelled edges of the shield gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The rowelled armor clanked as he prepared for battle.
